2019-09-22T14:26:21Z: In the cooldown room, Vettel asks if Leclerc lost a lot of weight during the race. He feels he definitely lost something big today.
2019-09-22T14:19:10Z: At the start of the weekend, very few would have had their money on Ferrari turning up in Singapore and winning - let alone taking a 1-2 finish. But, here we are. What a turnaround.
2019-09-22T14:17:41Z: Vettel won't have to rearrange the number boards this time, that #1 is all his.
2019-09-22T14:14:51Z: Outside the points: 11 Grosjean; 12 Sainz; 13 Stroll; 14 Ricciardo; 15 Kvyat; 16 Kubica; 17 Magnussen
2019-09-22T14:14:26Z: Result: 1 Vettel; 2 Leclerc; 3 Verstappen; 4 Hamilton; 5 Bottas; 6 Albon; 7 Norris; 8 Gasly; 9 Hulkenberg; 10 Giovinazzi
2019-09-22T14:13:53Z: It's a wild final few corners in the battle just outside the top 10 but Grosjean hangs on for 11th ahead of Sainz and Stroll.
2019-09-22T14:13:23Z: Norris successfully holds off Gasly and Hulkenberg for 'class B' honours in seventh, with Giovinazzi completing the scorers.
2019-09-22T14:12:57Z: Leclerc takes second ahead of Verstappen, who holds off Hamilton's pursuit, with Bottas in fifth.
2019-09-22T14:12:29Z: Vettel wins the 2019 Singapore Grand Prix!
2019-09-22T14:11:17Z: This will be Vettel's first win since the 2018 Belgian Grand Prix.
2019-09-22T14:11:03Z: On his fresh softs, Magnussen at least gets to set a crazily quick fastest lap in the 1m42s, though he won't get a bonus point for it as he'll finish outside the points.
2019-09-22T14:09:13Z: Two laps to go in Singapore!
2019-09-22T14:08:53Z: Hamilton is all over the back of Verstappen - but it's hard to see where he can get by at this stage.
2019-09-22T14:07:44Z: Bottas now sets the fastest lap with a 1m43.534s - he want's the extra point on offer.
2019-09-22T14:07:23Z: Sainz is still pressuring Grosjean for 11th, which is quite a result for Sainz given the amount of this race he spent a minute and a half behind the pack following his first-lap damage.
2019-09-22T14:07:06Z: Leclerc goes wide coming out of the Turn 13 hairpin following the bridge, which briefly allows Verstappen to close in.
2019-09-22T14:06:16Z: Magnussen is the latest person to pit for a new set of soft tyres in a 'down to last so may as well' stance.
2019-09-22T14:05:53Z: Vettel sets a new fastest lap with a 1m44.943s, which puts his lead over Leclerc up to 2.143s.
2019-09-22T14:05:14Z: Given the way Gasly and Hulkenberg had been scorching through the midfield on their fresher tyres, Norris's seventh place looked in real jeopardy after this last restart, but the McLaren is keeping them both at bay.
2019-09-22T14:04:41Z: Vettel's lead is up to 1.8s with just over four laps left to run.
2019-09-22T14:03:18Z: Magnussen's tyre struggle is now such that he's overtaken for 17th place by Kubica's Williams and pushed down to last.
2019-09-22T14:03:07Z: The top five are still covered by 5.3s - as Albon has now fallen away a touch.
2019-09-22T14:02:33Z: Vettel sets a new fastest lap with a 1m44.943s - that pulls him nicely clear of Leclerc at 1.4s.
2019-09-22T14:01:11Z: The two Ferraris are clear of Verstappen in third, who in turn is under a fair bit of pressure from Hamilton.
2019-09-22T14:01:05Z: Stroll has managed to pass both Kvyat and Magnussen in quick succession to progress to 14th.
2019-09-22T14:00:40Z: Seven laps to go in Singapore - Vettel heads Leclerc at 1.065s.
2019-09-22T13:58:52Z: The Ferraris match each other on 1m45.1s - but Vettel was fractionally faster - last time around.
2019-09-22T13:57:39Z: Magnussen is actually being passed by car after car on his worn tyres, he's now down to 14th with just Kvyat, Stroll and Kubica behind him.
2019-09-22T13:57:03Z: Leclerc is back in his customary (of-late in the this race) 0.9s gap to Vettel.
2019-09-22T13:56:47Z: Giovinazzi makes it past Magnussen into the points as he takes 10th, with Grosjean passing his team-mate too.
2019-09-22T13:55:50Z: The biggest consequence of Vettel going early appears to be Hamilton closing up to Verstappen P3-P4.
2019-09-22T13:55:10Z: Vettel has just left Leclerc behind - he nailed that restart as his team-mate had dropped a bit behind.
2019-09-22T13:54:47Z: The safety car is coming in - the race will restart on lap 52.
2019-09-22T13:53:32Z: Order: 1 Vettel; 2 Leclerc; 3 Verstappen; 4 Hamilton; 5 Bottas; 6 Albon; 7 Norris; 8 Gasly; 9 Hulkenberg; 10 Magnussen; 11 Giovinazzi; 12 Grosjean; 13 Sainz; 14 Ricciardo; 15 Kvyat; 16 Stroll; 17 Kubica
2019-09-22T13:53:06Z: Presumably this interruption will give Leclerc another chance to make his case for various extravagant engine settings to make a move on Vettel.
2019-09-22T13:51:58Z: The safety car is out AGAIN - this time so the Alfa Romeo can be recovered from the run-off at the first corners.
2019-09-22T13:51:43Z: Kvyat was taking a dive at Raikkonen into the first corner and they banged wheels, leaving Raikkonen with broken front suspension. Kvyat continues for now.
2019-09-22T13:51:05Z: Kvyat is trying very, very hard to pass Raikkonen for 12th... and they collide!
2019-09-22T13:49:39Z: Raikkonen looks like he let fresher-tyred team-mate Giovinazzi past into 11th.
2019-09-22T13:49:32Z: Leclerc is 0.9s behind Vettel - but he won't get DRS for another lap.
2019-09-22T13:49:26Z: Gasly passes Magnussen for eighth and again Hulkenberg follows him through. Next target for the charging pair is Norris.
2019-09-22T13:49:02Z: Ricciardo loses momentum trying to attack Kvyat and ends up being passed by both Grosjean and Sainz and falling to 16th.
2019-09-22T13:48:16Z: It's a bit like the last restart, Vettel scampers clear and Verstappen can't pressure Leclerc all that much. The Mercedes drivers look like they've managed their tyre warm up a bit better at this stage.
2019-09-22T13:48:11Z: Gasly is now immediately attacking Magnussen for eighth too as Gasly's later pitstop pays off.
2019-09-22T13:47:54Z: Gasly pounces on Raikkonen to take ninth, and Hulkenberg follows him through to push the Alfa out of the points.
2019-09-22T13:46:58Z: In fact Vettel is nearly a second clear in the lead.
2019-09-22T13:46:39Z: Leclerc is closer to Vettel than at the last restart, but not by much.
2019-09-22T13:46:25Z: Vettel lights it up - the race is back on!
2019-09-22T13:45:43Z: The safety car will come in at the end of lap 47.
2019-09-22T13:45:23Z: Leclerc is really not happy when Ferrari tells him about his settings for the restart.“I want everything, even engine mode,” he says.“Charles, We need to manage the bring the car home, we need to manage the PU and bring the car home,” Ferrari responds.“Yeah, I won’t do anything stupid - it’s not my goal,” is Leclerc’s frustrated response. “I want us to finish one-two, I just think it’s not fair. This won’t change, I won’t be stupid.”
2019-09-22T13:40:42Z: Stroll also makes another pitstop for more new softs, which he may as well do as he's now last.
2019-09-22T13:40:14Z: A recovery crane is being sent onto the track to pick up Perez's car - so this could be quite a lengthy safety car.
2019-09-22T13:39:14Z: Kubica is the only person to make a 'free' pitstop under this caution so far.
2019-09-22T13:38:00Z: Prior to this interruption, Norris had pulled out a handy advantage over Magnussen in the 'class B' lead.
2019-09-22T13:37:52Z: The safety car is called out again as Perez's car needs to be recovered on the long straight to Turn 14.
2019-09-22T13:36:34Z: Perez's Racing Point has slowed with an apparent mechanical problem. He was 10th just ahead of the Gasly/Hulkenberg battle.
2019-09-22T13:36:29Z: So despite Leclerc's rapid start to lap 43, Vettel actually ended up extending his lead by 0.2s.
2019-09-22T13:36:05Z: Gasly and Hulkenberg have a stern wheel to wheel battle for 10th, but the Toro Rosso is hanging on for now.
2019-09-22T13:35:41Z: Vettel was faster than Leclerc in sector two on lap 43.
2019-09-22T13:35:27Z: The stewards are investigating Grosjean for his incident with Russell.
2019-09-22T13:35:24Z: Leclerc sets a purple sector on lap 43 - he's really on it.
2019-09-22T13:35:01Z: It's as you were up front - the main action is Leclerc's pursuit of his team-mate.
2019-09-22T13:34:45Z: Stroll rejoins 19th and last, behind Sainz. In a development typical of Sainz's day, he didn't quite manage to catch the pack when allowed to unlap himself so is still 13s behind Kubica.
2019-09-22T13:34:12Z: Well to be completely accurate about Stroll, he also had front wing damage from the wing scraping on the ground following the puncture. That came from a bang of wheels with Gasly.
2019-09-22T13:33:56Z: Hamilton is 4.5s adrift of Vettel as the Mercedes drivers take a while to warm-up their tyres after the safety car.
2019-09-22T13:33:31Z: It's a puncture for Stroll rather than front wing damage.
2019-09-22T13:33:08Z: Stroll's heading for the pits, he's picked up damage to his front wing in one of those battles.
2019-09-22T13:33:06Z: Leclerc has a 1.1s lead over Verstappen P2-P3 - so not much pressure on Ferrari so far after the restart.
2019-09-22T13:32:30Z: Gasly puts a bold move on Stroll and manages to go around the outside of the Racing Point to take 11th. Hulkenberg follows him through.
2019-09-22T13:32:15Z: Hamilton and Bottas are a bit further back from Verstappen than they'd ideally like.
2019-09-22T13:31:57Z: Vettel's lead is 1.075s over Leclerc as they enter the final sector.
2019-09-22T13:31:19Z: Vettel has charged clear of Leclerc at the head of the snake.
2019-09-22T13:30:58Z: The leaders get through the restart without changing places so far.
2019-09-22T13:30:43Z: Vettel drops the hammer at the final chicane - he's clear of Leclerc and Verstappen.
2019-09-22T13:30:15Z: The safety car is coming in - Vettel backs the pack up. We'll be racing again at the start of lap 40 of 61.
2019-09-22T13:28:01Z: Sainz is being allowed to unlap himself - he's cleared the safety car, which is staying out for at least one more lap.
2019-09-22T13:24:53Z: The pack is about to start lap 39 of 61 - so still quite a way to go today.
2019-09-22T13:22:55Z: Order: 1 Vettel; 2 Leclerc; 3 Verstappen; 4 Hamilton; 5 Bottas; 6 Albon; 7 Norris; 8 Magnussen; 9 Raikkonen; 10 Perez; 11 Stroll; 12 Gasly; 13 Hulkenberg; 14 Kvyat; 15 Giovinazzi; 16 Ricciardo; 17 Kubica; 18 Grosjean; 19 Sainz
2019-09-22T13:22:11Z: Kvyat, Giovinazzi and Grosjean have all put softs on for the final 20 or so laps that will be left once the safety car period is over.
2019-09-22T13:21:12Z: Hulkenberg, Kvyat and Giovinazzi all choose to make pitstops under this safety car - that was always a possibility for Hulkenberg after his lap one stop.
2019-09-22T13:21:10Z: Hamilton had been 14s behind Vettel P1-P4 - but that'll be down to nothing now, albeit with Leclerc and Verstappen in between.
2019-09-22T13:20:24Z: Grosjean pitted for a new front wing after that incident with Russell. He rejoins 18th ahead of the hapless Sainz.
2019-09-22T13:20:20Z: So Vettel's advantage over Leclerc is gone - but now Hamilton has an easier job with his younger tyres.
2019-09-22T13:19:59Z: The Ferraris had the chance to pit when the safety car was called, but they've both stayed out.
2019-09-22T13:19:36Z: The safety car is called out.
2019-09-22T13:19:11Z: Russell's Williams is parked in the wall on the run down from Turn 8 still.
2019-09-22T13:18:52Z: Leclerc sets another new fastest lap 1m45.054s ahead of the Russell/Grosjean incident.
2019-09-22T13:18:49Z: Russell was side by side with Grosjean and ended up in the wall in an incident that surely invites a safety car.
2019-09-22T13:17:08Z: Leclerc set a new fastest lap of 1m45.250s last time around - he's now 4.8s behind Vettel.
2019-09-22T13:17:03Z: The stewards are taking a look at the Ricciardo/Giovinazzi clash.
2019-09-22T13:16:46Z: Giovinazzi now finally pits following that clash.
2019-09-22T13:16:20Z: Ricciardo has a puncture - he went to the inside of Giovinazzi at Turn 7 and as he had a slight bit of oversteer he slid and their tyres collided.
2019-09-22T13:15:35Z: But Ricciardo is slowing - looks like he's got damage.
2019-09-22T13:15:12Z: Giovinazzi and Ricciardo make contact at Turn 7! Both carry on.
2019-09-22T13:14:44Z: So, Vettel's lead is 5.9s over Leclerc, who is three seconds ahead of Verstappen.
2019-09-22T13:14:12Z: Hamilton passes Giovinazzi as Bottas passes Ricciardo - with Albon passing the Renault too as they approach the end of the lap.
2019-09-22T13:13:29Z: Gasly pits as well and rejoins behind Stroll in 16th.
2019-09-22T13:13:22Z: Verstappen uses DRS along the first straight to take third from Giovinazzi, as Hamilton passes Ricciardo for fifth.
2019-09-22T13:12:46Z: Stroll rejoins way back in 16th place, 8s behind the battling Perez and Kvyat. So the moral of that story is running long is only going to work if everyone else's tyres drop off in the remaining 29 laps.
2019-09-22T13:12:44Z: Leclerc takes second with an easy move at Turn 1, which puts Giovinazzi into Verstappen's clutches.
2019-09-22T13:12:15Z: Verstappen passes Gasly for fourth at the end of the back straight.
2019-09-22T13:11:53Z: Leclerc is straight on Giovinazzi, who is already over four seconds behind Vettel - Leclerc won't be happy when he gets by!
2019-09-22T13:11:19Z: Leclerc passes Gasly in the same spot as Vettel, except things were much smoother that time around.
2019-09-22T13:10:59Z: Vettel's move on Gasly will not be investigated by the FIA.
2019-09-22T13:10:39Z: Stroll pits from P7 - that releases the Mercedes pair and Albon.
2019-09-22T13:10:20Z: Verstappen has just passed Ricciardo as well.
2019-09-22T13:10:04Z: Leclerc update - he's passed Ricciardo and is behind Gasly.
2019-09-22T13:09:48Z: Now Hamilton has caught Stroll, with Bottas close behind.
2019-09-22T13:09:24Z: In fact Vettel is right with the Alfa and he goes into first around the outside into Turn 7.
2019-09-22T13:09:01Z: Vettel is catching Giovinazzi for the lead.
2019-09-22T13:08:49Z: In the background of the Vettel/Gasly incident, Verstappen passed Stroll for P6.
2019-09-22T13:08:24Z: Replays show Gasly just avoided major contact with Vettel - the Ferrari driver came from a long way back.
2019-09-22T13:08:01Z: Vettel and Gasly able to get by, with the Toro Rosso jumping over the run-off.
2019-09-22T13:07:42Z: Vettel dives to inside of Gasly at Turn 7 - looks like there was contact!
2019-09-22T13:07:07Z: Hamilton, Bottas and Albon are around three seconds behind Verstappen - P7-P10.
2019-09-22T13:06:27Z: Now Verstappen is stuck behind Stroll.
2019-09-22T13:05:59Z: Vettel passes Ricciardo at Turn 7 at the end of the long straight, and in the background Leclerc passes Stroll for P5.
2019-09-22T13:05:21Z: Order: 1 Giovinazzi; 2 Gasly; 3 Ricciardo; 4 Vettel; 5 Stroll; 6 Leclerc; 7 Verstappen; 8 Hamilton; 9 Bottas; 10 Albon; 11 Hulkenberg; 12 Norris; 13 Magnussen; 14 Raikkonen; 15 Perez; 16 Kvyat; 17 Russell; 18 Grosjean; 19 Kubica; 20 Sainz
2019-09-22T13:04:43Z: Vettel has shot up the road to catch Ricciardo in P3.
2019-09-22T13:04:26Z: Stroll is keeping Leclerc behind, which is letting Verstappen run all over the back of Ferrari.
2019-09-22T13:04:00Z: Hamilton has a six lap tyre-life advantage over Leclerc, and seven over Vettel.
2019-09-22T13:03:32Z: Vettel has cleared Stroll for P4, with Leclerc now harrying the Racing Point driver.
2019-09-22T13:03:07Z: So, Giovinazzi leads for Alfa Romeo, with Gasly and Ricciardo second and third.
2019-09-22T13:02:44Z: As Hamilton rejoined ahead of Bottas and Albon the Red Bull driver had to catch a big sideways moment at Turn 2 and he took to the runoff.
2019-09-22T13:02:11Z: Hamilton comes out in P8 - a net P4 - miles behind the Ferraris and Verstappen but ahead of Bottas after that Mercedes radio call.
2019-09-22T13:01:11Z: Vettel has caught Stoll in P5.
2019-09-22T12:59:46Z: Hamilton, Giovinazzi, Gasly, Ricciardo and Stroll are lapping in the 1m48s - while the Ferraris are in the 1m47s.
2019-09-22T12:57:48Z: Grosjean is the latest midfield runner to pit and rejoins behind Russell in 18th.
2019-09-22T12:57:11Z: So that radio message to Bottas suggests Hamilton will drop to a net P4 when he comes in.
2019-09-22T12:56:45Z: Despite running softs in the first stint when most of his midfield rivals could be on mediums having not reached Q3, and staying out long enough to be at risk of being undercut, Norris is still a solid 5s ahead of Magnussen and Raikkonen. They're now all back in 12th-14th.
2019-09-22T12:56:06Z: So Hamilton leads Giovinazzi, Gasly, Ricciardo and Stroll - then come the Ferraris.
2019-09-22T12:55:40Z: Albon makes it past Hulkenberg into Turn 7, so solves that temporary problem.
2019-09-22T12:54:21Z: Hamilton is still circulating up front.
2019-09-22T12:54:15Z: Albon fell to 11th when he pitted, and he's now behind the long-running Hulkenberg.
2019-09-22T12:53:34Z: Hamilton did a 1m47.085s last time around, but that was over 1.5s slower than Vettel.
2019-09-22T12:53:09Z: Vettel gets straight on it with a 1m45.453s new fastest lap. His next piece of yet-to-pit traffic is Stroll, who is 5.3s ahead.
2019-09-22T12:53:00Z: Bottas is also still out in P2 - both Mercedes are yet to pit.
2019-09-22T12:52:31Z: Hamilton stays out - but it looks as if he'd come out behind Vettel if he pits any time soon.
2019-09-22T12:51:44Z: As Leclerc rejoins he's behind Vettel! That slightly earlier pitstop paid off massively for Vettel.
2019-09-22T12:50:59Z: Early class B leader Norris pits now too.
2019-09-22T12:50:42Z: Verstappen rapidly passes Hulkenberg - which he had to as it seems Renault's going to try to keep its man out as long as possible on the hards he took on during his first-lap repairs.
2019-09-22T12:50:23Z: Leclerc pits - but Hamilton stays out!
2019-09-22T12:49:34Z: Vettel comes out in P10, but Verstappen rejoins P12 behind Hulkenberg - that hasn't worked for Red Bull.
2019-09-22T12:49:09Z: Vettel goes onto the hard tyres, as does Verstappen.
2019-09-22T12:48:44Z: Vettel and Verstappen pit! Here we go.
2019-09-22T12:48:26Z: Hulkenberg finally makes it past Grosjean after some very tough racing. The Renault is up to 13th but 12s behind Stroll ahead.
2019-09-22T12:47:35Z: Onto hard tyres for Magnussen and he rejoins narrowly in front of Raikkonen.
2019-09-22T12:47:31Z: On the last tour, Leclerc was back to a 1m49.011s, while Hamilton was 0.5s faster overall.
2019-09-22T12:47:05Z: Magnussen pits from ninth place, elevating Gasly and Ricciardo - who were right on his tail.
2019-09-22T12:47:01Z: Leclerc and Hamilton are yo-yoing again - it looks like Hamilton's main advantage is in the middle sector, but he's got the gap down overall to just 1.074s.
2019-09-22T12:46:24Z: Kubica isn't picking favourites - he made life just as hard for Perez as he had for Raikkonen. But the Racing Point now passes the Williams and Kvyat follows.
2019-09-22T12:46:00Z: Vettel is 2.3s adrift of Hamilton after the injection in pace at the front - it's not much but it is something.
2019-09-22T12:45:20Z: Still response from Vettel, Verstappen and co.
2019-09-22T12:45:08Z: The leading pair are into the 1m47s - the fastest they've done for quite a while.
2019-09-22T12:45:03Z: Ricciardo is now on Gasly's tail for 10th.
2019-09-22T12:44:45Z: Kubica is doing his utmost to hold off the already-pitted Raikkonen for 15th. The Alfa finally makes it, but Kubica put up a decent fight on his older tyres.
2019-09-22T12:44:37Z: Hamilton does respond - he's upped his pace in the middle sector on lap 17 of 61.
2019-09-22T12:43:37Z: Leclerc does a 1m48.303s last time around, that's pulled him clear to 1.9s ahead of Hamilton. Will Mercedes respond?
2019-09-22T12:42:37Z: Leclerc's lead is up to 1.7s - it looks like this might be the moment he brings the race up front alive.
2019-09-22T12:42:29Z: Raikkonen gets out just ahead of Perez and Kvyat, with all three right behind the yet-to-pit Kubica.
2019-09-22T12:42:07Z: Fastest lap now goes to Perez, a 1m46.683s.
2019-09-22T12:41:46Z: Raikkonen pits so Ricciardo moves up to 11th place.
2019-09-22T12:40:33Z: Fastest lap now goes to Kvyat on his fresh tyres, a 1m47.419s. Yes, the leaders haven't been pushing very hard...
2019-09-22T12:40:26Z: The clear danger for the leaders is that they pit and come out in traffic - although some of the midfield have been helpfully pitting.
2019-09-22T12:39:47Z: Hamilton has closed in on Leclerc and they've started to run clear of Vettel - but we're really not talking much.
2019-09-22T12:39:31Z: Ricciardo's next target is Raikkonen in 11th place, and he's now right on the Alfa's tail.
2019-09-22T12:39:07Z: Perez dives in for a pitstop too, and rejoins on hards just ahead of Kvyat.
2019-09-22T12:38:13Z: The top six are covered by 5.2s - with Norris a further three seconds back.
2019-09-22T12:37:10Z: Kvyat makes an early pitstop on lap 12 of 61, dropping his mediums to get some hards. He rejoins in 18th ahead of Russell.
2019-09-22T12:36:54Z: Not much to report among the leaders - the pace is still low and there's not a lot of action. In fact there's none.
2019-09-22T12:34:50Z: Perez passes Kvyat, the second Toro Rosso is down to 15th.
2019-09-22T12:34:20Z: No peace for Kvyat, he's now under heavy pressure for 14th from Perez.
2019-09-22T12:33:25Z: That was very nice opportunism from Stroll - he hung back as Ricciardo and Kvyat went wheel to wheel, kept momentum then breezed past the Toro Rosso on the corner exit.
2019-09-22T12:32:40Z: Ricciardo is all over the back of Kvyat and makes it past, with Stroll following him through and demoting Kyvat to 14th too.
2019-09-22T12:31:23Z: Having cleared Kubica for 17th, Hulkenberg is now rapidly catching 16th-placed Grosjean.
2019-09-22T12:30:06Z: You can see how easily the leaders are taking it - Hamilton's on-board action looks positively pedestrian.
2019-09-22T12:29:01Z: The gap between Leclerc and Hamilton is starting to yo-yo again, swinging between 0.8s and 1.3s - it's currently 1.0s.
2019-09-22T12:28:05Z: Ricciardo's on the hunt! He picks off Perez for P13#F1 #SingaporeGP https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EFEZC_aX4AAc7tk.jpg
2019-09-22T12:27:22Z: Russell bringing his battered Williams to the pit
2019-09-22T12:27:08Z: Ricciardo is now up to 13th from the back, squeezing through a narrow gap to complete a pass on Lance Stroll just now, and is off to chase Daniil Kvyat for 12th.
2019-09-22T12:26:28Z: It looks as if the front runners are going so slowly on their tyres that Norris is closing back in on Albon in P6-P7 - he's noticeably closer as they run down the straights, albeit a fair way back.
2019-09-22T12:26:25Z: Hulkenberg has caught up to the back of Kubica for 18th.
2019-09-22T12:26:08Z: It's easy to see why Sainz doesn't feel too perky about the prospect of spending all night with a damaged car - he's 1m18s behind 19th-placed Russell and lapping 2s slower than the Williams.
2019-09-22T12:25:04Z: Vettel has now brought Verstappen, Bottas and Albon back to the rear of Hamilton's Mercedes - they're bunched up again now.
2019-09-22T12:24:11Z: Hamilton is pulling out from Leclerc's slipstream where he can - looks like he's trying to cool something on his car.
2019-09-22T12:22:50Z: The gaps between the top six - other than the larger gap between Hamilton and Vettel - are pretty even, so it looks like everyone is going through a joyful tyre management phase.
2019-09-22T12:22:08Z: Another new fastest lap from Hulkenberg - a 1m47.539s. Running outside traffic, he's massively faster than everyone else in the field right now.
2019-09-22T12:21:34Z: Leclerc and Hamilton are starting to run clear of Vettel and Verstappen.
2019-09-22T12:21:00Z: The gap up front his back to 0.8s between Leclerc and Hamilton.
2019-09-22T12:20:11Z: Hulkenberg grabs fastest lap as he begins his chase of the pack - a 1m47.992s.
2019-09-22T12:19:59Z: Replays show Albon was challenged by Sainz at Turn 1 and he squeezed the McLaren through the second turn, causing it to check up.
2019-09-22T12:19:56Z: Order: 1 Leclerc; 2 Hamilton; 3 Vettel; 4 Verstappen; 5 Bottas; 6 Albon; 7 Norris; 8 Giovinazzi; 9 Magnussen; 10 Gasly; 11 Raikkonen; 12 Kvyat; 13 Stroll; 14 Ricciardo; 15 Perez; 16 Grosjean; 17 Kubica; 18 Hulkenberg; 19 Russell; 20 Sainz
2019-09-22T12:19:08Z: The gap between the top two had gone down to 0.6s, but Leclerc has edged that out to over a second again - this could be something that happens throughout the race.
2019-09-22T12:19:05Z: Sainz was already lapped by the time he emerged from that long trudge back to the pits and subsequent stop.
2019-09-22T12:18:28Z: After starting last having been thrown out of qualifying, Ricciardo is now up to 15th.
2019-09-22T12:18:23Z: Hamilton sets a new fastest lap with a 1m48.666s - seconds after Leclerc had set his own personal best.
2019-09-22T12:18:06Z: Replays suggest Russell sustained his damage coming together with Daniel Ricciardo at the first corner.
2019-09-22T12:17:53Z: But Hamilton has now cut Leclerc's advantage - the gap is swinging between them.
2019-09-22T12:17:38Z: Sainz has made it back into the pits with his punctured McLaren, and Russell has successfully been in and out to get a front row.
2019-09-22T12:17:19Z: Leclerc is eeking out his lead over lap two, it's up to 1.3s.
2019-09-22T12:17:14Z: Norris is back up to seventh with Hulkenberg's stop, ahead of Antonio Giovinazzi, Kevin Magnussen, Pierre Gasly and Kimi Raikkonen.
2019-09-22T12:16:51Z: Did Hulkenberg pick up damage in that tussle to get through to seventh? He's into the pits for repairs too.
2019-09-22T12:16:43Z: The top 6 have already pulled a massive gap on Norris in seventh, with Verstappen closing in on Vettel for third.
2019-09-22T12:16:03Z: Carlos Sainz Jr looks like he's picked up a puncture and is slowing, and George Russell's front wing is flapping too.
2019-09-22T12:16:00Z: After one lap Leclerc's lead is over a second clear of Hamilton, who has managed to pull clear of Vettel.
2019-09-22T12:15:34Z: Nico Hulkenberg muscled his way to the front of the 'Class B' pack in seventh via a long battle with Lando Norris through the opening corners.
2019-09-22T12:15:24Z: Verstappen runs fourth ahead of Bottas and Albon.
2019-09-22T12:14:56Z: Hamilton defends hard against Vettel, which has allowed Leclerc to escape up front.
2019-09-22T12:14:33Z: Vettel is all over Hamilton for P2 as they run down the straight to Turn 7.
2019-09-22T12:14:11Z: Leclerc gets a great start - he holds the lead in Turn 1.
2019-09-22T12:13:51Z: The Singapore Grand Prix is underway!
2019-09-22T12:13:30Z: The grid is forming up - it's nearly time to get racing in Singapore.
2019-09-22T12:12:41Z: The pack are into the final sector - obviously quite a lengthy warm-up tour, this one.
2019-09-22T12:10:12Z: The formation lap is underway at Marina Bay.
2019-09-22T12:08:20Z: One of the key questions is one of tyres. Nobody's sure if it's a one- or two-stop race, and a safety car would definitely mix that up. Managing the rears is going to be crucial too.
2019-09-22T12:05:59Z: Five minutes until lights out! Well, the starting lights - it would be a lot more difficult if all of the floodlights went off too!
2019-09-22T12:05:16Z: Every year at Singapore, there's been a safety car - will the circuit continue its 100% record?
2019-09-22T12:03:32Z: This is Leclerc's third consecutive pole, and he'll be hoping the electronics problems abate as he aims for his third consecutive win.
2019-09-22T12:02:57Z: And there's already drama! Polesitter Leclerc seems to be having an electronics issue in his car, but it seems to be okay.
2019-09-22T12:02:08Z: Even though it's dark, it's still pretty hot; the thermometers around the circuit read about 30C, and the track temperature is even warmer.
2019-09-22T12:00:07Z: Hello and welcome to the Autosport Live feed for the Singapore Grand Prix! In just 10 minutes, we'll be underway under the lights for 61 laps around the Marina Bay circuit.
